text: I am not sure that I like the idea of having different 'memory' arguments (as in the maskers). I'd prefer having a 'memory_level' and always use the same memory object.
title: Introduce a memory_level concept

text:
> I totally agree. Do you imagine more than 2 memory levels ?

Maybe. I tend to make these decisions based on experience: I profile and
separate out things that take a lot of time from things that are fasT.

Let's just put it as an integer for now, with 'bigger is more memory'.
This has been addressed by the CacheMixin by @pgervais . Closing, feel free to open if needed.
